citations.title: [Quantum Machine Learning for Protein Folding]( (arXiv, 2021) — Proof-of-concept, small peptides
[Quantum-Enhanced Feature Spaces for Protein Classification]( (Nature, 2019) — Quantum kernels
[Quantum Annealing for Protein Folding]( (Scientific Reports, 2012) — Early work, small peptides
[QAOA for Protein Design]( (arXiv, 2021) — Theoretical
[Hybrid Quantum-Classical Approach for Protein Folding]( (arXiv, 2023) — Theoretical framework
[Quantum-Enhanced Protein Structure Prediction]( (Physical Review Research, 2022) — Small peptides
[RFdiffusion for Multi-State Design]( (Nature, 2023) — Classical state-of-the-art
[VQE for Molecular Energies]( (Nature Communications, 2014) — Small molecules
[Quantum Chemistry for Drug Design]( (Nature Reviews Chemistry, 2020) — Review
[Quantum ML for Drug Discovery]( (arXiv, 2021) — Small molecules
[Quantum Generative Models]( (Nature Machine Intelligence, 2019) — General framework
[QAOA for Combinatorial Optimization]( (arXiv, 2014) — General QAOA
[Constrained Protein Design]( (Science, 2022) — Classical methods
1. **[AlphaFold3: Predicting Protein-Ligand Interactions]( (Abramson et al., Nature 2024) — Classical state-of-the-art
2. **[RFdiffusion: De Novo Protein Design]( (Watson et al., Nature 2023) — Classical generative design
3. **[Quantum Machine Learning for Protein Folding]( (Outeiral et al., arXiv 2021) — Quantum for proteins (small peptides)
4. **[Quantum Kernels for Classification]( (Havlíček et al., Nature 2019) — Quantum ML
5. **[Quantum Annealing for Protein Folding]( (Perdomo-Ortiz et al., Scientific Reports 2012) — Early quantum protein work
6. **[Hybrid Quantum-Classical Neural Networks]( (Farhi & Neven, arXiv 2018) — General hybrid framework
[AlphaFold3]( — Nature, 2024
[ProteinMPNN]( — Science, 2022
[IBM Quantum]( — Quantum hardware access
[D-Wave Systems]( — Quantum annealing
